etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Robert Mayne (1808–1868). From scientific Latin Nemocera (P. A. Latreille in Nouveau dictionnaire d'histoire naturelle X. 288; irregularly from ancient Greek νῆμα thread + κέρας horn: see kerato-) + -ous

definitions: Belonging or relating to the group Nemocera (now the suborder Nematocera) of dipteran flies; nematoceran, nematocerous.
